%%pyspark
import pandas as pd
import xml.etree.ElementTree as ET
import urllib.request

#Get the filtered url, which is filtered by starting date and end date and also Norway,Sweden and Denmark
url = ("https://sdmx.oecd.org/public/rest/data/"
       "OECD.ELS.SAE,DSD_POPULATION@DF_POP_HIST,"
       "/NOR+SWE+DNK.POP.PS._T+M+F._T.?"
       "startPeriod=1990&endPeriod=2024")

req = urllib.request.Request(url, headers={'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0'})
xml_data = urllib.request.urlopen(req).read()

#Handle the xml data contained in the url
root = ET.fromstring(xml_data)

ns = {
    "generic": "http://www.sdmx.org/resources/sdmxml/schemas/v2_1/data/generic",
}

#Convert this into a table
rows = []
#find all the values, in this case country, measue(population), sex, age 
for series in root.findall(".//generic:Series", ns):
    series_key = {v.attrib["id"]: v.attrib["value"]
                  for v in series.findall("generic:SeriesKey/generic:Value", ns)}

#find all the observations in the series, for this xml it is year and population
    for obs in series.findall("generic:Obs", ns):
        year = obs.find("generic:ObsDimension", ns).attrib["value"]
        value = obs.find("generic:ObsValue", ns).attrib["value"]
        
        #create row with all the series_key, id and value, and also 
        #create the year and value from the observations found earlier and assign appropriate names
        row = series_key.copy()
        row["TIME_PERIOD"] = year
        row["POPULATION"] = int(value)
        rows.append(row)

#Convert the rows into a pandas dataframe
df_pandas = pd.DataFrame(rows)
df_pandas.head(30)

#convert into a spark df and then store it in our staging folder in parquet format

spark_df = spark.createDataFrame(df_pandas)
output_path = "abfss://group3fpfilesystem@group3fpadls.dfs.core.windows.net/staging/population.parquet"
spark_df.write.mode("overwrite").parquet(output_path)
